solution_line_template: With two substitutions, {players_start_first_half}+{substitutions_first_half} = <<{players_start_first_half}+{substitutions_first_half}={players_played_first_half}>>{players_played_first_half} players from the team played the game in the first half.

In the second half, the team made twice the number of substitutions it made in the first half, a total of {multiplier_second_half_subs}*{substitutions_first_half} = <<{multiplier_second_half_subs}*{substitutions_first_half}={substitutions_second_half}>>{substitutions_second_half} substitutions.

The total number of players who played the game is {players_played_first_half}+{substitutions_second_half} = <<{players_played_first_half}+{substitutions_second_half}={total_players_played}>>{total_players_played}

If the soccer team had {total_players_prepared} players prepared for the soccer game, the number of players who did not play the game is {total_players_prepared}-{total_players_played} = <<{total_players_prepared}-{total_players_played}={players_did_not_play}>>{players_did_not_play} players.
